      • haversineDistance

        public static double haversineDistance(double lon1,
                       double lat1,
                       double lon2,
                       double lat2)
        Calculate the spherical distance between two GeoCoordinates in meters using the Haversine formula. This calculation is done using the assumption, that the earth is a sphere, it is not though. If you need a higher precision and can afford a longer execution time you might want to use vincentyDistance
        Parameters:
        lon1 - longitude of first coordinate
        lat1 - latitude of first coordinate
        lon2 - longitude of second coordinate
        lat2 - latitude of second coordinate
        Returns:
        distance in meters as a double
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if one of the arguments is null

      • getPointOnGreatCircle

        public static Location getPointOnGreatCircle(double latitude,
                             double longitude,
                             double d,
                             double bearing)
        Returns a coordinate on the great circle at the specified bearing.
        Parameters:
        latitude - the latitude of center of circle
        longtitude - the longitude of center of circle
        d - the distance from the center
        bearing - the great circle bearing
        Returns:
        a coordinate at the specified bearing

        public static boolean isBetterLocation(Location location,
                       Location currentBestLocation)
        Determines whether one Location reading is better than the current Location fix
        Parameters:
        location - The new Location that you want to evaluate
        currentBestLocation - The Location fix, to which you want to compare the new one
        Returns:
        true of location is better than currentBestLocation

      • lawOfCosineDistance

        public static double lawOfCosineDistance(double lon1,
                         double lat1,
                         double lon2,
                         double lat2)
        Calculate the spherical distance between two points using the Spherical law of Cosines formula.

        Its a more accurate than the haversine distance and gives an accuracy of upto 1 metre.

        Parameters:
        lon1 -
        lat1 -
        lon2 -
        lat2 -
        Returns:
        Distance in Km

        latitude - the latitude at which the calculation should be performed
        Returns:
        longitude degrees

      • validateLatitude

        public static double validateLatitude(double lat)
        Checks the given latitude value and throws an exception if the value is out of range.
        Parameters:
        lat - the latitude value that should be checked.
        Returns:
        the latitude value.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the latitude value is < LATITUDE_MIN or > LATITUDE_MAX.

      • validateLongitude

        public static double validateLongitude(double lon)
        Checks the given longitude value and throws an exception if the value is out of range.
        Parameters:
        lon - the longitude value that should be checked.
        Returns:
        the longitude value.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the longitude value is < LONGITUDE_MIN or > LONGITUDE_MAX.

      • vincentyDistance

        public static double vincentyDistance(Location gc1,
                      Location gc2)
        Calculates geodetic distance between two GeoCoordinates using Vincenty inverse formula for ellipsoids. This is very accurate but consumes more resources and time than the sphericalDistance method Adaptation of Chriss Veness' JavaScript Code on http://www.movable-type.co.uk/scripts/latlong-vincenty.html Paper: Vincenty inverse formula - T Vincenty, "Direct and Inverse Solutions of Geodesics on the Ellipsoid with application of nested equations", Survey Review, vol XXII no 176, 1975 (http://www.ngs.noaa.gov/PUBS_LIB/inverse.pdf)
        Parameters:
        gc1 - first GeoCoordinate
        gc2 - second GeoCoordinate
        Returns:
        distance in meters between points as a double

      • dateLineCrossOver

        public static boolean dateLineCrossOver(double longitude1,
                        double longitude2)
        Returns true if the line segment connecting the two specified longitudes crosses the international dateline.
        Parameters:
        longitude1 - first longitude
        longitude2 - second longitude
        Returns:
        true if the line segment crosses the internation dateline, false otherwise

      • getCircularRegion

        public static Location[] getCircularRegion(int numberOfPoints,
                           double centerLatitude,
                           double centerLongitude,
                           double radius)
        Gets the circular region approximation on the earth surface using haversine formula.

        Given a center point, this method returns a points around the given center.

        Parameters:
        numberOfPoints - the number of points used to estimate the circular region
        centerLatitude - latitude of the center point
        centerLongitude - longitude of the center point
        Returns:
        an array of LatLon representing the points that estimate the circular region
